newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: Holderbank results hit by weak economy.
newsitem.headline: Holderbank results hit by weak economy.

text.p: Holderbank Financiere Glarus AG, the Swiss cement and construction materials company, said the weak economy in European countries hurt its profits in the first half of 1996.

"After years of continuous growth, a number of countries -- mainly in Europe -- have slid into recession. Compounding the situation was an unexpectedly harsh winter that halted many construction projects from northern Germany to the plains of Hungary over a period of months. Holderbank could not avoid being affected by this adverse trend, and the financial performance in the first half of 1996 was weaker than expected," it said in a statement.
The company said its consolidated net income after taxes fell by 7.5 percent, or 23 million Swiss francs, to 283 million.
After deducting minority shareholder's interests, Holderbank's share of net income totaled 217 million Swiss francs, a drop of 8.0 percent or 19 million.
It said that sale of non-strategic assets raised additional ordinary income by 92 million Swiss francs to 128 million.
